Description: Upon receipt of a Request the cFE shall allocate a block of memory of the specified size from the specified Memory Pool.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Memory Allocation interface allows the cFE Application to allocate a block of memory from a previously created memory pool.

Description: If the specified Memory Pool identifier is invalid then the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): If the handle or Memory Pool ID is not valid, then an error must be returned.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request the cFE shall allocate a block of memory of the specified size from the specified Memory Pool.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Memory Allocation interface allows the cFE Application to allocate a block of memory from a previously created memory pool.

Description: If the specified size is too large for the specified Memory Pool, the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Cannot allocate a memory block bigger than the pool.

Description: The cFE shall maintain an Executive Services Logic Analyzer Capture Log for capturing application specified timestamps and events for off-line performance analysis.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Logic Analyzer Capture Log is used along with a performance log API to allow the cFE and cFE Applications to save performance data that can be downloaded.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall record the specified Logic Analyzer Capture Tag in the Logic Analyzer Capture Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE Core and cFE Applications make specific calls to create log entries in the Logic Analyzer Capture Log.

Summary: ES: Analyzer Log Record Tag - Overwrite On Full
Description: If the Logic Analyzer Capture Log is full, then the cFE shall write all new entries from the top of the log.

Summary: ES: Analyzer Log Record Tag - Timestamp
Description: The cFE shall store a timestamp along with the specified Logic Analyzer Capture Tag.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Each entry is time-stamped.

Summary: ES: Analyzer Log Write To File
Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall copy the information contained in the Logic Analyzer Capture Log into a Command Specified file.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to be able to capture the log to a file for post processing.

Summary: ES: Analyzer Log Write To File - Default Filename
Description: If a file is not specified, the cFE shall use the `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` filename.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to have a default filename.

Description:
Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall generate a message that contains a summary of the Command specified Application's properties and state as defined in the Systems Resources Definition including: 

- cFE Application Name 
- cFE Application Filename 
- cFE Application Entry Point 
- cFE Application Priority 
- cFE Application Stack Size 
- cFE Application Memory Start Address 
- cFE Application Memory Size 
- cFE Application Child Task Count
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): In order to support remote Application management then the Application's properties and current state need to be externally observable.  Because the ground interface is with Applications rather than Tasks, Task information should be included as well.

Summary: ES: Application Status Record To File
Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall generate a Command specified file that contains all properties and states of all cFE Applications that are defined in the Systems Resources Definition.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): May want information about all applications and tasks defined in the Systems Resources Definition in order to diagnose a problem.

Summary: ES: Application Status Record To File - Default Filename
Description: If a file is not specified, the cFE shall use the `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` filename.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to specify a default if the user does not want to specify a new filename.

Description:
Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall calculate a Data Integrity value over the given range of memory using the specified algorithm. The algorithm shall be one of the following:

- XOR: Exclusive OR
- CRC16: 16 Bit Cyclic Redundancy Check
- CRC32: 32 Bit Cyclic Redundancy Check
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): We need to provide a checksum/CRC utility.

Summary: ES: Copy From Critical Data Store
Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall copy the contents from the Request specified Critical Data Store to the Request specified address.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides the capability to restore the local data with the contents of the critical data store.

Summary: ES: Copy From Critical Data Store - Invalid Data Integrity
Description: If the Data Integrity Value is invalid then the data shall not be copied from the Critical Data Store.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Critical Data Store should be verified before restoring.  Assumes that if the calculated CRC does not match the stored CRC than the CDS cannot be trusted.

Summary: ES: Copy From Critical Data Store - Non-Existent
Description: If the Request Specified Critical Data Store does not exist then the data shall not be copied.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can't copy data if the reference is wrong.

Summary: ES: Copy To Critical Data Store
Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall copy the data starting at the Request specified address to the Request specified Critical Data Store.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Applications need to periodically copy the local data into the CDS so that it can be preserved.  Note that the CDS is not required to exist on-card (local address space).  This provides the capability for a mission to use off-card bulk storage.

Summary: ES: Copy To Critical Data Store - Calculate Data Integrity Value
Description: The cFE shall calculate a Data Integrity Value for the Request specified Critical Data Store and store it.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Every time data is written to the CDS, a CRC must be recalculated in order to have a reference for any CDS validation.  Note that Applications are responsible for determining whether the contents of a CDS Block are still logically valid.

Summary: ES: Copy To Critical Data Store - Invalid Critical Data Store
Description: If the Request Specified Critical Data Store does not exist then the data shall not be copied.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can't copy data if the reference is wrong.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall create the specified cFE Child Task within the cFE Application that owns the task and begin execution of the task.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Each cFE Application's main task has the capability to create and start one or more child tasks.

Summary: ES: Create Child Task - Invalid From Child Task
Description: In the event a child task attempts to create another child task, the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Only the cFE Application's main task can create a child task. This prevents confusion with parent/child task relationships and the allocation/deallocation of resources.

Summary: ES: Create Child Task - Report Error
Description: In the event that the cFE Child Task cannot be created, the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to keep track of the Child Task Create Failures.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall delete the Command Specified Critical Data Store.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): As part of an Application clean-up, want to clean-up the allocated resources.

Description: The cFE shall support a `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` byte Critical Data Store.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): TBD seems like a reasonable size based on heritage missions.

Summary: ES: Critical Data Store Write To File
Description:
Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall copy the following Critical Data Store information into the Command Specified file:

1. Critical Data Store Name
2. Size
3. Data Integrity Value
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This provides a registry of the Critical Data Store.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request the cFE shall de-allocate the specified block of memory from the specified Memory Pool.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Memory Allocation interface allows the cFE Application to de-allocate a block of memory from a previously created memory pool.

Description: If the specified Memory Pool identifier is invalid, then the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to have a valid Memory Pool identifier in order to de-allocate a block of memory.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall delete the Command specified Application including all child tasks.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to be able to stop the execution of an Application and remove its System Resources.  The delete will clean-up the application's main task and all of its child tasks.  Note: other cFE components are required to have cleanup routines that ES calls.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall delete the specified Application including all child tasks.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to be able to stop the execution of an Application and remove its System Resources.  The delete will clean-up the application's main task and all of its child tasks.  Note: other cFE components are required to have cleanup routines that ES calls.

Description: If the specified Application is undefined then the cFE shall reject the Command, increment the invalid command counter and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can't delete an undefined application.

Description: If the specified Application is undefined then the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can't delete an undefined application.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall delete the specified cFE Child Task within the cFE Application that owns the task.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): As part of a cFE Application cleanup, the Application needs to be able to delete each child task.

Summary: ES: Delete Child Task - Error If Application Main Task
Description: If the specified task is the cFE Application Main Task, the request shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Cannot use Child Task Exit or Delete on the cFE Application Main Task.

Description: The cFE shall detect all unmasked processor Floating Point Exceptions.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The low level BSP routines allow the mission to determine what Floating Point exceptions are masked, and what Floating Point exceptions can interrupt the software.

Description: Upon detection of an unmasked Floating Point exception, the cFE shall add an entry in the Executive Services Exception and Reset Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to log unmasked Floating Point exceptions so that the ground can have visibility into the exception.

Summary: ES: Detect FP Exceptions - Platform Response
Description: If the Floating Point exception was caused by the OS or cFE Core then the cFE shall initiate a `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` response.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): An exception in the cFE core or OS will restart the cFE, which results in all cFE Applications being restarted.

Summary: ES: Detect FP Exceptions - Restart App
Description: If the Floating Point exception was caused by a cFE Application and the Exception Action indicates that the Application can be started individually, the cFE shall restart the cFE Application that caused the exception.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want the capability to restart an individual application on a processor reset.  Not all Applications should be started individually as they may have some dependencies that result in undesirable behavior.  When the Application is started, one of the parameters is whether to restart the app of perform a cFE processor reset.

Description: The cFE shall detect all unmasked CPU exceptions.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to be able to detect processor exceptions so that the appropriate action can be taken.

Description: Upon detection of a CPU exception, the cFE shall add an entry in the Executive Services Exception And Reset Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to log processor exceptions so that the ground can have visibility into the exception.

Summary: ES: Detect Unmasked Exceptions - Platform Response
Description: If the CPU exception was caused by the Operating System or cFE Core then the cFE shall initiate a `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` response.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): An exception in the cFE core or OS will restart the cFE, which results in all cFE Applications being restarted.

Summary: ES: Detect Unmasked Exceptions - Restart App
Description: If the CPU exception was caused by a cFE Application and the Exception Action indicates that the Application can be started individually, the cFE shall restart the cFE Application that caused the exception.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): In most cases, restarting the cFE application will clear up the problem. In some cases, however, applications are tightly coupled with other applications in which case, starting an individual application may have undesirable consequences.  The cFE should provide the ability to define if the application should can be restarted or if a processor reset should occur.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall disable a specified hardware device driver.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need a way of unloading, stopping a hardware device driver.

Summary: ES: Disable Device Driver - Not Loaded
Description: If the specified hardware device driver is not loaded, then the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Cannot disable a device driver that is not loaded.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall re-enable a specified hardware device driver.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need a way to re-enable the device driver and it's associated interrupt.

Summary: ES: Enable Device Driver - Not Loaded
Description: If the specified hardware device driver is not loaded, then the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Cannot disable a device driver that is not loaded.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall end execution of the calling cFE Child Task.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): cFE Child Task needs to be able to exit and end execution.

Summary: ES: End Child Task - Error If Application Main Task
Description: If the calling task is the cFE Application Main Task, the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Cannot use Child Task Exit or Delete on the cFE Application Main Task.

Summary: ES: Exception And Reset Log Size
Description: The cFE shall support a `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` byte Executive Services Exception And Reset Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): TBD seems like a reasonable size based on heritage missions.

Description:
The cFE shall maintain an Executive Services Exception and Reset Log which will log critical system data for exceptions and resets including: 

- A time stamp 
- Processor Context information 
- Critical system variables 
- ASCII string stating the reason for the reset
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to be able to save state information prior to a restart (processor, power-on, application, task etc) to help with diagnosing problems.  There is a separate requirement for the creation of a file to transfer the information to the ground.

Summary: ES: Exception and Reset Log - Clear On Command
Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall clear the Executive Services Exception and Reset Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to be able to clear the Executive Services Exception and Reset Log so that only the new information is saved.

Summary: ES: Exception and Reset Log - Default Filename
Description: If a file is not specified, the cFE shall use the `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` filename.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to provide a default in the event a user does not want to have to specify one.

Summary: ES: Exception and Reset Log - Write To File
Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall copy the information contained in the Executive Services Exception and Reset Log Buffer into a Command specified file.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE Exception and Reset Log contains a large amount of data, and is variable in size. It is easier to dump the contents to a file.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall exit the calling cFE Application and delete the Applications' resources.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to have a cFE program exit. This request can be used for both critical errors and a planned shutdown of a cFE application.

Description:
Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall generate a Software Bus message that includes the following items:

- Number of Registered Applications
- Number of Registered Child Tasks
- Number of Registered Shared Libraries
- Reset Type
- Reset Subtype
- Number of entries in System Log
- Size of the System Log
- Number of bytes used in the System Log
- Current Exception and Reset Log Index
- Number of Processor Resets
- Maximum Number of Processor Resets before a Power On Reset
- Boot Source
- ES Valid Command Counter
- ES Invalid Command Counter
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): It is common for sub-systems to report housekeeping status upon receipt of a housekeeping request command.

Description: Upon receipt of an invalid Command, the cFE shall increment the invalid Command counter and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The ground needs an indicator if a command is rejected by the cFE. Details of what makes a command invalid are documented in the cFE Application Developer's Guide and the cFE User's Guide.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall load and initialize a hardware device driver and connect it with the specified hardware handshaking and device processing code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need a standard device driver interface.

Description: The cFE shall support a maximum `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` cFE Applications.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): TBD has never been exceeded on past missions.  Need to bound the number of Applications in order to size the Systems Resources information.

Description: If the cFE Core goes through `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` Maximum Processor Resets, the cFE shall initiate a Power-On Reset of the cFE.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): After a <PLATFORM DEFINED> number of Processor Resets, the cFE will attempt to recover by doing a Power-on Reset.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall generate a NO-OP event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This command is useful as a general sub-system aliveness test.

Description: The cFE shall support a `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` byte non-volatile file system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): TBD seems like a reasonable size based on heritage missions.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall submit to the operating system shell, the string supplied as a parameter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Having access to the operating system shell has proved invaluable during FSW development on missions such as JWST and Triana.  Although it is available on-orbit, it is not intended to be used during normal operations.

Summary: ES: Pass String To Shell - Message Response
Description: Upon execution of the operating system Command, the cFE shall generate one or more messages containing the ascii output generated by the operating system command.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This message will provide the "output" from the shell command to allow the implementation of a shell like interface to the cFE.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall perform a Power On Reset of the Core Flight Executive.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): On a flight processor or other embedded processor this command results in rebooting the processor board through the Boot Software. On a desktop system this command will result in the restarting of the cFE, but not the operating system. Note: If the cFE implementation includes more than one cFE core images, it is the responsibility of the Boot Software to select which cFE image is booted.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall perform a Power On Reset of the Core Flight Executive.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to be able to reset the cFE in the event that there is a critical problem. The direct call is provided in the case where the normal task message passing is not working. As a result of the Power On Reset, all code and data are re-initialized and the cFE is returned to itâ€™s default power-on state.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Clear Critical Data Store
Description: Upon a Power-On Reset, the cFE shall clear the contents of the Critical Data Store.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The purpose of the critical data store is to save data that an Application wants to preserve across a processor restart. This area will be cleared during a Power-On Reset.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Clear Exception and Reset Log
Description: Upon a Power-On Reset, the cFE shall clear the Executive Services Exception and Reset Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to be able to get a snapshot of some critical parameters prior to a reset as well as log the resets that have occurred.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Clear System Log
Description: Upon a Power-On Reset, the cFE shall clear the Executive Services System Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to be able to determine what errors are logged by the cFE. This log is not preserved on a Power-On reset.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Clear Volatile File System
Description: Upon a Power-On Reset, the cFE shall clear the Volatile File system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Volatile File system is initialized during a Power-on Reset.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Create OS Objects
Description: Upon a Power-on Reset, the cFE shall create all operating system objects required by the cFE.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This is a table driven startup that includes: Core cFE Applications, semaphores, queues, and shared memory segments. It can also contain calls to initialize device drivers and interrupts.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Exception and Reset Log Entry
Description: Upon a Power On Reset, the cFE shall make an entry in the Executive Services Exception and Reset Log, recording the Power On Reset.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): One purpose of the Executive Services Exception and Reset Log is to log all resets.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Identify Sub-Type
Description: Upon a Power-on Reset, the cFE shall identify the <PLATFORM_DEFINED> Power On reset sub-type.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Each mission may want to further distinguish between Processor reset types in order to tailor their system's behavior.  For example a mission may want to take different behavior for a watchdog time out and the execution of the processor's reset instructions.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Mount Non-Volatile File System
Description: Upon a Power-on Reset, the cFE shall mount the non-volatile file system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Non-volatile file system contains the files for each of the cFE Applications. On a Power-On reset, the external cFE Applications are loaded from the Volatile file system.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Process Startup File
Description: Upon a Power-on Reset, the cFE shall process all entries in the cFE Startup File located in the non-volatile file system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): There is a file that contains all of the Applications, Shared Libraries, and Device Drivers that are to be created and started.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Process Startup File - Init Device Drivers
Description: The cFE shall create and initialize cFE Device Drivers according to the entry in the cFE Startup File.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE supports loading and initializing cFE Device Drivers during system startup.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Process Startup File - Init Libs
Description: The cFE shall create and initialize cFE Shared Libraries according to the entry in the cFE Startup File.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE supports creating and initializing cFE Shared Libraries during system startup.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Process Startup File - Start Apps
Description: The cFE shall create and start cFE Applications according to the entry in the cFE Startup File.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE supports loading and creating new cFE Applications during system startup.

Summary: ES: Power On Reset Set Up Volatile File System
Description: Upon a Power-on Reset, the cFE shall create, format and mount the volatile file system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The volatile file system is a key part of the cFE. It is used for logs, data files and new cFE Applications.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall prepare a Memory Pool for run time memory allocation/de-allocation.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Memory Allocation interface allows the cFE Application to supply a Pool of memory, which can be used for efficient memory allocation and de-allocation.

Summary: ES: Prepare Memory Pool - Too Small
Description: If the specified size is less than the <PLATFORM_DEFINED> minimum block size, the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): If the size of the Pool is not valid, then an error must be returned.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall perform a Processor Reset of the Core Flight Executive.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to be able to restart the cFE in the event that there is a problem with the Real Time OS or cFE Core software. Note that restarting the cFE will result in a restart of all of the cFE applications. In addition, a restart of the cFE will initialize the (TBD - missing text from pre 2011).

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall perform a Processor Reset of the Core Flight Executive.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to be able to restart the cFE in the event that there is a problem with the cFE core. The direct call is provided in the case where the normal task message passing is not working.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Create OS Objects
Description: Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall create all operating system objects required by the cFE.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Items such as tasks, semaphores, queues, and shared memory segments would be initialized.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Create OS Objects - Power On Reset On Failure
Description: If the creation of the operating system object fails, the cFE shall perform a `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` response.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The response to operating system object creation failure depends on the platform configuration, and is abstracted at the platform layer.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Exception and Reset Log Entry
Description: Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall make an entry in the Executive Services Exception and Reset Log recording the Processor Reset.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The purpose of the Executive Services Exception and Reset Log is to log all resets and all exceptions that occur.

Description: Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall identify the <PLATFORM_DEFINED> Processor reset sub-type.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Each mission may want to further distinguish between Processor reset types in order to tailor their system's behavior.  For example a mission may want to take different behavior for a watchdog time out and the execution of the processor's reset instructions.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Mount Non-Volatile File System
Description: Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall mount the non-volatile file system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Non-volatile file system contains the files for each of the cFE Applications. On a Power-On reset, the external cFE Applications can be loaded from the Volatile file system.

Description:
Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall preserve the following: 

- Boot Source 
- Reset Type 
- Reset Subtype 
- Reset Reason 
- Number of Processor Resets 
- Maximum Processor Resets 
- Number of entries in System Log 
- Size of System Log 
- Number of bytes used in the System Log
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The purpose of the Executive Services Exception and Reset Log is to log all resets and all exceptions that occur.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Preserve Critical Data Store
Description: Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall preserve the contents of the Critical Data Store.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The purpose of the critical data store is to save data that an Application wants to preserve across a processor restart.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Preserve Exception and Reset Log
Description: Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall preserve the Executive Services Exception and Reset Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): ES needs to retain this information to support diagnosing cause of processor reset as well as preserving information that is required to  count the number of resets.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Preserve System Log
Description: Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall preserve the Executive Services System Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to be able to determine what errors are logged by the cFE. This log is not preserved on a Power-On reset.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Preserve Volatile File System
Description: Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall preserve the Volatile File system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): During a processor reset, the Volatile File System and it's contents will be preserved.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Process Non-Volatile Startup File
Description: If the system startup file is not present in the volatile file system then the cFE shall process all entries in the cFE Startup File located in the non-volatile file system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to have a default system startup file which is used if there is no system startup file in volatile memory.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Process Non-Volatile Startup File - Start Apps
Description: The cFE shall create and start cFE Applications according to the entry in the cFE Startup File.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE supports loading and creating new cFE Applications during system startup.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Process Non-Volatile Startup File - Init Libs
Description: The cFE shall create and initialize Shared Libraries according to the entry in the cFE Startup File.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE supports loading and initializing cFE Shared Libraries during system startup.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Process Volatile Startup File
Description: Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall process all entries in the cFE Startup File located in the volatile file system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): There is a file that contains all of the cFE Applications and Shared Libraries that are to be loaded and started. The cFE will check to see if this file is in the volatile file system. This file facilitates restarting a processor using patches that were made.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Process Volatile Startup File - Start Apps
Description: The cFE shall create and start cFE Applications according to the entry in the cFE Startup File.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE supports loading and creating new cFE Applications during system startup.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Process Volatile Startup File - Init Libs
Description: The cFE shall create and initialize Shared Libraries according to the entry in the cFE Startup File.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE supports loading and initializing cFE Shared Libraries during system startup.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Set System Log Mode To Discard
Description: Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall set the System Log Mode to discard.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to preserve the System Events that may have captured the cause of the processor reset.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Set Up Volatile File System
Description: Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall check and mount the volatile file system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to preserve the Volatile file system across a processor reset.

Summary: ES: Processor Reset Set Up Volatile File System - Format On Failure
Description: If the volatile file system check fails, the cFE shall format the volatile file system and create a system log entry.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): If the volatile file system is corrupt, it must be reformatted to allow the cFE to function.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall set the Processor Resets counter to zero.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ground may want to clear this counter so that infrequent Processor Resets don't result in a Power-on Reset.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall register the calling cFE Application with the system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): cFE Applications must register with the cFE in order to allow the cFE to track the Application's resources. This function also allows the system to synchronize the application startup. The cFE Application will wait in this function until the cFE starts up.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall register the calling cFE Child Task with the system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Just like cFE Applications, Child Tasks must be registered to work properly in the cFE. This function call is intended to be called by the newly created cFE Child Task.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command the cFE shall Reload the Command specified cFE Application from the Command specified cFE Application file.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This command enables the ground to replace an Application with only one command. This is required for applications such as a Command Uplink Application, which must be replaced with one command. The specified cFE Application file may be from any valid cFE.

Summary: ES: Reload Application - Delete On Non-Parameter Error
Description: If the cFE Application Reload fails due to a non-parameter error, then the cFE shall delete the Application, increment the invalid Command counter, and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): If the Application is already stopped and there is an error restarting it, then the cFE application will be deleted. Should the old Application be restarted?  Need to be able to reset the cFE in the event that there is a critical problem. As a result of the Power On Reset, all code and data are re-initialized and the cFE is returned to a default power-on state. This reset is initiated through a common interface.

Summary: ES: Reload Application - Reject On Missing File
Description: If the specified cFE Application file does not exist then the cFE shall reject the command, increment the invalid Command counter, and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can't reload the Application if the new file does not exist.

Description: If the specified Application is undefined then the cFE shall reject the Command, increment the invalid Command counter and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can't reload an undefined Application.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the cFE Application ID of the calling cFE Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): A cFE Application needs to determine its own Application ID.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the cFE Application ID which corresponds to the specified cFE Application Name.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Executive Services will assign an Application ID. The Application Name is specified when the cFE Application is created.  This Request will provide a way to determine the cFE Application ID when the pre-determined Application Name is passed in.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the cFE Application Name which corresponds to the specified cFE Application ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Executive Services will assign an Application ID. This Request will provide a way to determine an Application's name from its Application ID.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the type of last reset performed by the processor.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): cFE Applications may perform processing that is specific to each reset type.

Description: The reset types include: Power On Reset Processor Reset.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): cFE Applications may perform processing that is specific to each reset type.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the Processor ID on which the Request was made.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to determine the Processor ID. This feature is useful in missions with multiple processors, or to help distinguish prototype vs. flight processor features.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the Spacecraft ID on which the Request was made.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to determine the Spacecraft ID. This feature is useful in missions with multiple Spacecraft, or Spacecraft with multiple processors.

Summary: ES: Report Task and Application Name
Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide the cFE Task Name and cFE Application Name which corresponds to the specified cFE Task ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The command will provide a way to find the cFE Task Name and the parent cFE Application name from any cFE Application or Child task.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall reserve the Request specified amount of memory in the Critical Data Store for the cFE Application using the Request specified name.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The Critical Data Store will be used by Applications to store critical parameters that will be preserved after an application or processor restart. ES will allocate the memory for the application.  A pointer or memory address will be provided to the alloc.

Summary: ES: Reserve Critical Data Store - Invalid Data Integrity
Description: If a Critical Data Store exists for the Request specified name but the Data Integrity value is invalid, the cFE shall remove the existing Critical Data Store and create a new one using the Request specified name and size.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Assumes that if the CRC is invalid then the CDS can't be trusted.

Summary: ES: Reserve Critical Data Store - Size Change
Description: If a Critical Data Store exists for the Request specified name but has a different size than what is specified in the Request, the cFE shall remove the existing Critical Data Store and create a new one using the Request specified name and size.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Assumes that if the sizes don't match then something has changed and the CDS can't be trusted.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall Restart the Command specified Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to be able to restart an Application. A restart involves deleting it (cleaning up) and then starting it again. This is similar to starting the cFE Application from a file system. When an Application is restarted, the only command parameter required is the application name. All other parameters including the filename are the same as the original cFE Application Create command. The restart is intended for error recovery such as an exception, and should not be used to start a new version of an Application. If a Critical Data Store Area is allocated for the Application, it is preserved, and the Application may re-connect to the Critical Data Store Area when it is running again.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request the cFE shall Restart the specified Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to be able to restart an Application. A restart involves deleting it (cleaning up) and then starting it again. This is similar to starting the cFE Application from a file system. When an Application is restarted, the only parameter required is the application name. All other parameters including the filename are the same as the original cFE Application Create Request. The restart is intended for error recovery such as an exception, and should not be used to start a new version of an Application. If a Critical Data Store Area is allocated for the Application, it is preserved, and the Application may re-connect to the Critical Data Store Area when it is running again.

Summary: ES: Restart Application - Delete On Non-Parameter Error
Description: If the cFE Application Restart fails due to a non-parameter error, then the cFE shall delete the Application, increment the invalid Command counter, and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): If the Application is already stopped and there is an error restarting it, then the cFE application will be deleted.

Summary: ES: Restart Application - Delete On Non-Parameter Error
Description: If the cFE Application Restart fails due to a non-parameter error, then the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): If the Application is already stopped and there is an error restarting it, then the cFE application will be deleted.

Summary: ES: Restart Application - Reject On Missing File
Description: If the original cFE Application file is not found then the cFE shall reject the Command, increment the invalid Command counter, and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can't restart the Application if the original file has been removed. In this case, the Application will continue without a restart.

Summary: ES: Restart Application - Reject On Missing File
Description: If the original cFE Application file is not found then the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can't restart the Application if the original file has been removed. In this case, the Application will continue without a restart.

Description: If the Command specified Application is undefined then the cFE shall reject the Command, increment the invalid Command counter and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can't restart an undefined application.

Description: If the specified Application is undefined then the cFE shall record the error in the System Log, and return an error code.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can't restart an undefined application.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall set the Maximum Processor Resets counter to the Command Specified value.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Based on ST-5 experience, want to be able to increase the maximum number of Processor Resets in order to prevent a Power-on Reset.  ST-5 used these features when they were having the multiple bit errors in their recorder memory. They set both numbers to 4.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall create the Command specified Application by defining the Application in the System Resources Definition using information from the Command specified file, and beginning execution of the Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): A basic feature of the cFE is to be able to dynamically (while the cFE is running) start applications. This requirement allows for an application to be created and started from one of the cFE file systems.

Description:
The Command shall include the following parameters:

- Application Path/Filename 
- Application Entry Point 
- Application Name 
- Application Priority 
- Application Stack Size 
- Application Load Address 
- Exception Action (restart application or perform processor reset)
The Command specified cFE Application file shall be in any valid cFE file system including the volatile file system and the non-volatile file system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The command itself does not care about where the cFE Application comes from, it is specified In the path.

Summary: ES: Start Application - Reject Already Running
Description: If the Command specified Application is already defined and executing, then the cFE shall reject the Command, increment the invalid Command counter and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can't start an application that is already running.

Description: If the Command specified Application is undefined then the cFE shall reject the Command, increment the invalid command counter and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Can't start an undefined application.

Description: The cFE shall maintain an Executive Services System Log which contains a series of ASCII text strings describing significant events or errors.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Examples of ES System Log information includes: "Created new cFE Application:  StoredCommand.app" or "Could Not Create OS Queue" or "File not found error: /eebank1/StoredCommand.app" This requirement states that the cFE needs to maintain this information.  There is a separate requirement for the creation of a file to transfer the information to the ground. Note that the information can also be obtained with a raw memory read.

Description:
The cFE shall calculate the number of bytes used and number of entries in 
Executive Services System Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ground operations need indication of how full the System Log is so that they can clear it, if necessary, in order to make room for new entries (or at least write it to a file to preserve it).

Summary: ES: System Log - Clear On Command
Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall clear the Executive Services System Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to be able to clear the Executive Services System Log Buffer so that only the new information is saved.

Description: If a file is not specified, the cFE shall use the `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` filename.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to provide a default in the event a user does not want to have to specify one.

Summary: ES: System Log - Discard On Full
Description: If the Executive Services Syste Log is full and the System Log Mode is set to DISCARD then the cFE shall discard all new entries.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to provide capability to stop writing to the System Log in order to preserve to Log which may contain important anomalous messages.

Summary: ES: System Log - Overwrite On Full
Description: If the Executive Services System Log is full and the System Log Mode is set to OVERWRITE then the cFE shall write all new entries from the top of the log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to provide the capability to continuously record all new System Messages.

Description: Each entry in the Executive Services System Log shall be time tagged with the time that the event happened.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to be able to determine when the event occurred.

Summary: ES: System Log - Write To File
Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall copy the information contained in the Executive Services System Log into a Command specified file.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): We did not want to count on a file system for storing the ES System errors in the event that there was a problem with the file system or the file system was not mounted yet.  We did want to provide an easy ground interface for getting the data to the ground

Description: Upon receipt of Command, the cFE shall set the System Log Mode to the Command-specified mode, either overwrite or discard.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): While in Overwrite Mode the oldest logged System  message will be overwritten by the new System message when the System Log Full Flag is set to true.  While in Discard Mode the new message will be discarded, preserving the contents of the full log.

Description: The cFE shall support a `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` byte Executive Services System Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): TBD seems like a reasonable size based on heritage missions.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall unload a specified hardware device driver and de-allocate all previously allocated resources used by the driver.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need a way of unloading, stopping a hardware device driver.

Description: Upon receipt of a valid Command, the cFE shall increment a valid Command counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The ground needs the capability to verify that the command was received and accepted by the cFE.  Details of valid commands are documented in the cFE Application Developer's Guide and the cFE User's Guide.

Description: The cFE shall support a `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` byte volatile file system.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): TBD seems like a reasonable size based on heritage missions.

Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall set to zero the valid Command counter and invalid Command counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This command is a common feature in heritage sub-system software design. In general, command counter (valid and invalid) are reset.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall add the specified Event Filter for the specified cFE Application and Event ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to provide the ability for filters to be added at runtime.  Original implentation did not provide this capability which resulted in modifications to Applications for those events that were not registered (i.e. forgotten).

Summary: EVS: Add Event Filter - Application Maximum
Description: If the maximum number of Event IDs have been registered for the specified Application then the cFE shall reject the command and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): In order to scale the cFE, allocations are made for each cFE Application (see cEVS3302).

Summary: EVS: Add Event Filter - Reject Already Filtered
Description: If the Event ID is already registered for filtering, the cFE shall reject the command and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Filter is done on a per Event ID basis.

Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ Upon receipt of Command, the cFE shall clear the Local Event Log.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to be able to clear the log if the event logging is operating in discard mode.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall enable/disable, as specified in the Command, the future generation of Event Messages for the Command-specified Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): During development and integration it can be useful to turn off an Application's Event Message's without regard of the Event Type.

Summary: EVS: Control Message By Application and Event Type
Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall enable/disable, as specified in the Command, the future generation of Event Messages for the Command-specified Application and Event Type.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): When diagnosing an Application it's useful to enable its informational and diagnostic Event Messages.

Summary: EVS: Control Message By Event Type
Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall enable/disable, as specified in the Command, the future generation of Event Messages for the Command-specified Event Type.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Filtering by type allows the system to behave differently for different users.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall enable/disable, as specified in the Command, the routing of all future Event Messages to the Command specified Event Message Port.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Event Message Output Ports may not be available or needed; therefore the ability to configure sending to an Event Message Port is useful.

Description:
Upon receipt of a Request to send an Event Message, the cFE shall create a Short or Long Event Message, as specified by the SB Event Format Mode, ONLY if the following cFE conditions are met: 

1. The requesting Application's Event Service Enable Status is Enabled. 
2. The requesting Application's registered message filtering algorithm indicates the message should be sent. 
3. The requesting Application's Event Type Enable Status is Enabled for the Event Type of the request-specified Event Message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports cFE event services.

Description: The requester shall be able to specify the Application ID to be used in the Event Message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to provide APIs a way to specify an Application ID to ensure the context of the Event is correct.

Description:
The cFE shall support the following data types within an applications Request specified Event Data: 

- Signed Character 
- Unsigned Character 
- Short Integer 
- Unsigned Short Integer 
- Long Integer 
- Unsigned Long Integer
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Not all processors supported under the cFE will allow floating point or real types.

Summary: EVS: Create Message - Increment Filter Counter
Description: If the request specified Event ID has been registered for binary event filtering, the cFE shall increment the request specified Application's Binary Filter Counter for the request-specified Event ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Support binary event filtering algorithm.

Summary: EVS: Create Message - Increment Filter Counter - Retain Maximum Value
Description: If the Binary Filter Counter has reached its maximum value of (2^16)-1, the cFE shall retain the maximum value (i.e. do not rollover to zero).
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Preventing a counter rollover to zero eliminates the case when a user may think no events have occurred when in fact many events have occurred.

Description: If the SB Format Mode is set to Long, the cFE shall generate an SB Event Message formatted as specified in the cFE User's Guide containing the Spacecraft Time, Processor ID, Application ID, Event ID, Event Type, and the Request-specified Event Data.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): To assist with system test and diagnostics it is important to distinguish otherwise identical messages by their sources.  This is especially true in a distributed system with common subsystems. It is the intent of this requirement to allow identical subsystems to be resident in multiple processors within the flight system.  In cases like this, the subsystem identifier, and message identifier may be the same; only the processor identifier would make the messages unique.  A long format is desirable because it contains the most information.  Design Note: It is expected that in the implemented event service, the API only requires the Event ID and Type, and that the underlying utility code fills in the processor ID, and Application ID before the message is sent.

Summary: EVS: Create Message - Long Format - Truncation
Description: If the Event Data is greater than the `<MISSION_DEFINED>` maximum Event Data, the cFE shall truncate the Event Message with a string-termination character and increment the Message Truncation Counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): It's important to know if data is lost, but it doesn't need to be maintained on a per-Event ID basis, therefore a single counter is used.  A platform-defined length was considered but this prevents application reuse unless a minimum length is specified.

Description: If the SB Format Mode is set to Short, the cFE shall generate an SB Event Message formatted as specified in the cFE User's Guide containing the spacecraft time, Processor ID, Application ID, Event ID, and Event Type.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Providing a short format accommodates missions with limited telemetry bandwidth.

Description: The requester shall be able to specify the time to be used in the Event Message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This routine should be used in situations where an error condition is detected at one time, but the event message is reported at a later time.

Description: If the requesting Application has been determined to be unregistered the cFE shall increment the Unregistered Application Send Counter and send an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Provides ground operators the ability to see when unregistered applications are using event services.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall delete the specified Event Filter for the specified cFE Application and Event ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to be able to remove event filtering since the cFE limits the number of filters that can be registered for a given cFE Application (see cEVS3302).

Summary: EVS: Delete Event Filter - Reject Not Registered
Description: If the Event ID is not registered for filtering then the cFE shall reject the command and generate an event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Notify caller that the Filter was not registered.

Description: The cFE shall support `<PLATFORM_DEFINED, 8>` Event Message Filters per cFE Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Each cFE Application that register with EVS is allocated memory to support this limit.

Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ The cFE shall define a Local Event Log with a capacity of `<PLATFORM_DEFINED, 20>` Event Messages.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Each mission's processor card memory capacities will dictate what is reasonable.

Description: Upon receipt of Request the cFE shall free resources allocation for the specified Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to be able to remove all resources associated with an application when Deleting, Restarting or Reloading an Application.  In addition, this is required as part of a Processor Reset.

Description:
The cFE shall provide the following Event Service data items in telemetry (SB Messages): 

- Valid Command Counter
- Invalid Command Counter 
- SB Event Format Mode
- Event Message Sent Counter 
- Event Message Truncation Counter 
- Unregistered Application Send Counter 
- Event Message Output Port Enable Statuses 
- _(OPTIONAL)_ Local Event Log Full Flag 
- _(OPTIONAL)_ Local Event Log Overflow Counter 
- _(OPTIONAL)_ Logging Mode 
- For each registered Application:
  o Application Event Message Sent Counter 
  o Application Event Service Enable Status

Summary: EVS: Increment App Message Sent Counter
Description: For each created Event Message, the cFE shall increment the Application Event Message Sent Counter for the request specified Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): A counter provides a means for keeping track of how many events an application has sent through the event service. Note: The Application Event Message Sent Counter is incremented once regardless of how many enabled ports the message has been sent through.

Summary: EVS: Increment App Message Sent Counter - Retain Maximum Value
Description: If the Application Event Message Sent Counter has reached its maximum value of (2^16)-1, the cFE shall retain the maximum value (i.e. do not rollover to zero).
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Preventing a counter rollover to zero eliminates the case when a user may think no events have occurred when in fact many events have occurred.

Description: For each created Event Message, the cFE shall increment the Event Message Sent Counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): A counter provides a means for keeping track of how many events have been sent through the event service. Note: The Event Message Sent Counter is a count of ALL messages sent through the Event Service regardless of the Application sending the event. The Event Message Sent Counter is incremented once regardless of how many enabled ports the message has been sent through.

Summary: EVS: Increment Message Sent Counter - Retain Maximum Value
Description: If the Event Message Sent Counter has reached its maximum value of (2^16)-1 the cFE shall retain the maximum value (i.e. do not rollover to zero).
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Preventing a counter rollover to zero eliminates the case when a user may think no events have occurred when in fact many events have occurred.

Summary: EVS: Initialize Format To Long On Power On Reset
Description: Upon a Power-on Reset, the cFE shall set SB Event Format Mode to Long.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Each mission must determine what format they need.

Summary: EVS: Initialize Full Flag To False On Power On Reset
Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ Upon a Power-on Reset, the cFE shall set the Local Event Log Full Flag to false.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Set cFE to default status across Power-on Resets.

Summary: EVS: Initialize Logging Mode On Power On Reset
Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ Upon a Power-on Reset, the cFE shall set the Event Logging Mode to `<PLATFORM_DEFINED, overwrite>`.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Set cFE to default status across Power-on Resets.

Summary: EVS: Initialize Message Port State On Power On Reset
Description:
Upon a Power-on Reset, the cFE shall set the `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` Event Message Output Ports to their `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` default state: 

- Port Number 1: `<PLATFORM_DEFINED, Enabled >` 
- Port Number 2: `<PLATFORM_DEFINED, Disabled >` 
- Port Number 3: `<PLATFORM_DEFINED, Disabled >` 
- Port Number 4: `<PLATFORM_DEFINED, Disabled >`
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Event Message Ports are customized for each platform.  A rationale for all of the Power-on Reset requirements is that the cFE must initialize to a known state.

Description: Upon receipt of an invalid command, the cFE shall in increment the invalid command counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The ground needs an indicator if a command is rejected by the cFE. Details of what makes a command invalid are documented in the cFE Developer's Guide and the cFE User's Guide.

Description: For each created Event Message, the cFE shall route the Event Message, formatted as an ASCII text string, to each enabled Event Message Output Port.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Debug ports are very useful for FSW development and maintenance.

Description: The cFE shall support the following Event Message Types: Debug Informational Error Critical.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports cFE event services.

Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall generate a NO-OP event message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This command is useful as a general sub-system aliveness test.

Summary: EVS: Preserve Event Log Reset Mode On Processor Reset
Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall preserve or overwrite the contents of the Local Event Log based on the setting of the Event Logging Mode configuration parameter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Try to retain the contents even across a processor reset because there may be useful diagnostic information. The contents of the Local Event Log will be preserved if the Event Logging Mode is configured to Discard (1). The contents of the Local Event Log may be overwritten (depending on the size and contents of the log prior to the reset) if the Event Logging Mode is configured to Overwrite (0).

Summary: EVS: Preserve Log Full State On Processor Reset
Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall preserve the Local Event Log Full state.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Retain the cFE state across Processor Resets.

Summary: EVS: Preserve Log Overflow Counter On Processor Reset
Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall preserve the Local Event Log Overflow Counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Retain the cFE state across Processor Resets.

Description: Upon receipt of Request, the cFE shall register an Application for event service, enabling the Application Event Service Enable Status and storing the following request specified Application data: Application Event IDs (for events to be filtered) Application Binary Filter Masks (one per registered Event ID).
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports the cFE's dynamic Application model.

Summary: EVS: Register App - Create Filter Counter
Description: Upon receipt of Request to register an Application for event service, the cFE shall create one Application Binary Filter Counter per registered Event ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports the cFE's Binary Filtering Algorithm.

Summary: EVS: Register App - Create Sent Message Counter
Description: Upon receipt of Request to register an Application for event service, the cFE shall create an Application Event Message Sent Counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports the cFE's dynamic Application model.

Summary: EVS: Register App - Default Event Enable Status
Description: Upon receipt of Request to register an Application for event service, the cFE shall use the `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` Application Event Type Enable Statuses for each event.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): By default each platform should have a standard configuration for each event message type (eg. DEBUGs disable.  INFO, ERROR and CRITICAL events DISABLED) that should be applied to all events.  Commands are available to modify the settings.

Summary: EVS: Set App Filter Mask By Event ID
Description: Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall set an Application's Binary Filter Mask to the Command-specified Event Filter for the given Application Event ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Allow an operator to tune the system for a particular operational environment.

Description: Upon receipt of Command, the cFE shall set the SB Event Format Mode to the command specified value, either Long or Short.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Providing a short format accommodates missions with limited telemetry bandwidth. A long format is desirable because it contains the most information.

Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ Upon receipt of Command, the cFE shall set the Event Logging Mode to the Command-specified mode, either overwrite or discard.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): While in Overwrite Mode the oldest logged event will be overwritten by the new event when the Event Log Full Flag is set to true.  While in Discard Mode the new event will be discarded, preserving the contents of the full log. Need the ability to switch between Event Message logging modes.

Summary: EVS: Set Logging Mode On Processor Reset
Description:
_(OPTIONAL)_ Upon a Processor Reset, the cFE shall set the Event Logging Mode to the `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` value.

TBD - doesn't match rationale
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Retain the cFE state across Processor Resets.

Summary: EVS: Store Message In Event Log
Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ For each created Event Message, the cFE shall store the Event Message in the Local Event Log in the Long Event Message Format.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): It's useful to save Event Messages when external communications is unavailable. This may occur during system initialization (especially events generated from other cFE components) and during a communications failure.

Summary: EVS: Store Message In Event Log - Increment Overflow Counter
Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ If the Local Event Log is full, the cFE shall increment the Local Event Log Overflow counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ground operations needs to know how many Event Messages were discarded or overwritten.

Summary: EVS: Store Message In Event Log - Log Full Behavior
Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ If the Local Event Log is full, the cFE shall either (1) overwrite the oldest Event Message if the Event Logging Mode is overwrite, or (2) discard the Event Message if the Event Logging Mode is discard.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Overwriting the oldest message is useful for nominal operations because a user doesn't need to periodically clear the Log. If an error occurs when there's no communication then the Local Event Log size must be large enough to retain the Event Messages since communications was lost. Discarding the newest Event Message is useful for trouble shooting a problem. For example there may be a problem during processor initialization that occurs when there's no communications with the processor interfacing with the User. In this case the original Event Messages are critical to solving the problem so they should be preserved. Note that the Event Logging Mode can be changed via stored commanding.

Summary: EVS: Store Message In Event Log - Set Full Flag
Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ If the Local Event Log becomes full, the cFE shall set the Local Event Log Full Flag to true.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ground operations needs to know the state of the Local Even Log.

Description: The cFE shall support `<PLATFORM_DEFINED, 4>` Event Message Ports.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Since the number of Event Message Ports is hardware dependent a mission must be able to specify how many ports it will support.

Description:
Upon receipt of Request, the cFE shall un-register an Application from using event services, deleting the following Application data: 

- Application Event Message Sent Counter 
- Application Event Service Enable Status 
- Application Event Type Enable Statuses (one for each Event Type) 
- Application Filtered Event IDs 
- Application Binary Filter Masks (one per registered Event ID) 
- Application Binary Filter Counters (one per registered Event ID)
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports the cFE's dynamic Application model allowing applications to clean up after themselves.

Description: Upon receipt of valid command, the cFE shall increment the valid command counter.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The ground needs the capability to verify that the command was received and accepted by the cFE.  Details of valid commands are documented in the cFE User's Guide.

Description:
Upon receipt of Command, the cFE shall write the following information to the Command specified cFE EVS Application Data file for each registered Application: 

- Application Event Message Sent Counter 
- Application Event Service Enable Status 
- Application Event Type Enable Statuses (one for each Event Type) 
- Application Event IDs (for events to be filtered) 
- Application Binary Filter Masks (one per registered Event ID) 
- Application Binary Filter Counters (one per registered Event ID)
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Visibility of Application information is essential for FSW diagnostics, testing and maintenance.

Summary: EVS: Write Application Data File - Default Filename
Description: If a file is not specified, the cFE shall use the `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` filename.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to provide a default in the event that a user does not want to specify.

Summary: EVS: Write Local Event Log Order
Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ The cFE shall write each Event Message from the earliest logged message to the most recently logged message.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Ground operators like to see the progression of events in the order that they occurred.   In a scenario when a time correction has been made, the earliest logged may not necessarily mean the oldest time stamp.  This type of playback may not be desirable for Event Logs of considerable size.  It is worthwhile for cFE users to keep Event Logs relatively small.

Summary: EVS: Write Local Event Log To File
Description: _(OPTIONAL)_ Upon receipt of Command, the cFE shall write the contents of the Local Event Log to the Command specified file.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Allows for ground view of the log.  Local Event Log is not intended for operation playback.  The main purpose of the Local Event Log is for ground testing.  Ground operators may view the data file for playing back stored events.

Summary: EVS: Write Local Event Log To File - Default Filename
Description: If a file is not specified, the cFE shall use the `<PLATFORM_DEFINED>` filename.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Want to provide a default in the event that a user does not want to specify one.

Summary: EVS: Zero App Filter Counter By Event ID
Description: Upon receipt of Command, the cFE shall set an Application's Binary Filter Counter to zero for the Command-specified Event ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Clearing an Application's Filtered Event Message Counter is a convenient method for resetting the filter on the event.

Summary: EVS: Zero App Filter Counter By Event ID
Description: Upon receipt of a request, the cFE shall set an Application's Binary Filter Counter to zero for the Application request-specified Event ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Clearing an Application's Binary Filter Counter is a convenient method for resetting the filter on the event.

Description: Upon receipt of Command, the cFE shall set all of an Application's Binary Filter Counters to zero.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Having the ability to reset all Application Filtered Event Message Counters is a quick method for resetting all the application's event filters. Note: This command gives operators the ability to reset all exhausted event filters (i.e. send 16 and stop) so that filtered events may be generated once again.

Description: Upon receipt of a request, the cFE shall set all of an Application's Binary Filter Counters to zero for the request-specified Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Having the ability to reset all Application Filtered Event Message Counters is a quick method for resetting all the application's event filters.

Summary: EVS: Zero Application Message Sent Count
Description: Upon receipt of Command, the cFE shall set the Command-specified Application's Event Message Sent Counter to zero.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Allow operators the ability to reset the count of application events.

Description:
Upon receipt of Command the cFE shall set the following counters to zero in Event Services telemetry:

- Valid Command Counter 
- Invalid Command Counter 
- Event Message Sent Counter 
- Event Message Truncation Counter 
- Unregistered Application Send Counter
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): This command is a common feature in heritage sub-system software design.

Summary: SB: Control Message Route To Pipe
Description: Upon receipt of a Command, the cFE shall enable or disable routing the command specified message to the command specified pipe.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Supports testing and maintenance. In testing, it may be desirable to enable/disable routing a message to a diagnostic application.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request to create a Pipe, the cFE shall create a Pipe with the Request-specified Pipe Depth and the Request-specified name.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Run time creation of Pipes supports the cFE goals of easy Application integration and system reconfiguration.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request to delete a Pipe, the cFE shall Unsubscribe all messages to the Request-specified Pipe, then remove the Pipe from the Routing Information.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): An Application must be capable of freeing its own resources.

Description: Upon receipt of Request the cFE shall free resources allocation for the specified Application.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Need to be able to remove all resources associated with an application when Deleting, Restarting or Reloading an Application. In addition, this is required as part of a Processor Reset.

Description:
The cFE shall send an SB Message containing the following housekeeping telemetry items: 

- Valid command counter 
- Invalid command counter 
- No subscriptions counter 
- Message send error counter 
- Message receive error counter 
- Pipe overflow error counter 
- MsgId-to-pipe limit error counter
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): SB Telemetry is essential for operations, FSW diagnostics, testing, and maintenance.

Summary: SB: Initialize Routing On Power On Reset
Description: Upon a Power-on Reset the cFE shall initialize the Routing Information and clear all error counters.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE must initialize to a known state.

Summary: SB: Initialize Routing On Processor Reset
Description: Upon a Processor Reset the cFE shall initialize the Routing Information and clear all error counters
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE must initialize to a known state.

Description: Upon receipt of a Request, the cFE shall provide sender information for the last message received on an Application's Pipe.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Heritage SB did a 'valid senders check' before delivering a packet to a pipe. Since the cFE supports a dynamic environment and the sender of a packet is somewhat unknown, the cFE must provide a means for the application to do the 'valid sender check'.

Description: The cFE shall support a maximum of `<PLATFORM_DEFINED, 64>` Destinations for a Message ID.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Allow a mission to scale the number of destinations per message ID to reduce memory requirements. A maximum is specified to yield an efficient design. The default of 16 is used in the heritage SB.

Description: The cFE shall support a maximum of `<PLATFORM_DEFINED, 1024>` Message ID's.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Allow a mission to scale the number of messages it can process to reduce SB memory usage.  A maximum is specified to yield an efficient design. 1024 was chosen as the default based on the message count of previous missions.

Description: The cFE shall support a `<MISSION_DEFINED, 32768>` bytes maximum system packet size.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): The cFE must have some protection in the event that the packet length field of a sender's packet becomes corrupted or is invalid.

Description: The cFE shall support a maximum Pipe depth of `<PLATFORM_DEFINED, 65535>` SB Messages.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Allow a mission to scale the Pipe depth to reduce memory requirements.  The default of 65535 is a power of 2 which may simplify implementation and based on recent missions 64 SB Messages is more than adequate.

Description: The cFE shall support a maximum of `<PLATFORM_DEFINED, 255>` Pipes per processor.
Custom field (Requirement Rationale): Allow a mission to scale the number of Pipes to reduce memory requirements.  The default of 255 allows a single byte to be used for the pipe id.

Description:
Upon receipt of a NOOP command, the cFE shall increment the command counter.
